body_html:
@asimshankar Yes I think with decode_compressed then most of the compression processing could be considered as apply the op to the input/output.

This PR was trying to address the issue raised #14593 which was early.

Later on #14887 was opened, so PR #15132 was created.

At the moment there are several ops that support option of compression:

TextLineDataset
TFRecordDataset
TFRecordReader
TFRecordReaderV2
FixedLengthRecordReaderV2

So there might be some overlap/inconsistency on which method/option to use when dealing with compressions.

Maybe there could be some consolidation for that, or just leave old method alone if the API could not change any more?

I am open either way. Or we could just close this PR for now.

body:
@asimshankar Yes I think with `decode_compressed` then most of the compression processing could be considered as apply the op to the input/output.

This PR was trying to address the issue raised #14593 which was early. 

Later on #14887 was opened, so PR #15132 was created.

At the moment there are several ops that support option of compression:
```
TextLineDataset
TFRecordDataset
TFRecordReader
TFRecordReaderV2
FixedLengthRecordReaderV2
```

So there might be some overlap/inconsistency on which method/option to use when dealing with compressions.

Maybe there could be some consolidation for that, or just leave old method alone if the API could not change any more?

I am open either way. Or we could just close this PR for now.
